summary.body: [b]For the people whose balconies look miserable and want to do something at a very reasonable price:[/b] I have seen this morning that the Greengrocer in Goswell Road has increased the numbers of plants and flowers. The prices are very low : a huge orange begonia only  2,20! The quality is very high! The jasmin I bought last year is growing so much that I have to cut it.... They are open from 8,00 a.m. till 5,30 p.m. not Sat or Sun (unfortunately!). They sell also soil fertilizers and organic substances against the white flies etc which infest the Barbican. They will advise you about the plants you can use in your balcony (sun exposure etc) they are very kind... Some empty balconies look awful, and I think is part of your lease to have a lovely balcony... i'n'it?
summary.subject: Plants and flowers

summary.body: Whilst planting up some planters this week I discovered a white bug in the earth that I have identified as the dreaded Vine Weevil larvea. This bug to those who do not know, will eat the roots of your plants and by the time you normally discover it, your plants are dead. Planters are particularly at risk, so I have ordered some biological pest control, trouble is as always I have enough for 12 square metres arriving and only have 1 if that to do.  If anyone would like some (as it has to all be used once the packet's opened) please let me know. PS if you want to order your own then I found this company from the RHS:
